DataElement.preferredName: Tissue Donor Cell Leukapheresis Collection Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person._The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid._Removal of the blood to collect specific blood cells; the remaining blood is returned to the body._The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place._Indicator of Yes, No, Unknown, Not Done, or Not Applicable to a question.[manually curated]

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person._The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid._Removal of the blood to collect specific blood cells; the remaining blood is returned to the body._The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person.:The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid. Cells are highly variable and specialized in both structure and function, though all must at some stage replicate proteins and nucleic acids, utilize energy, and reproduce themselves.

Concepts.definition: Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person.
The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid.

Property.preferredDefinition: Removal of the blood to collect specific blood cells; the remaining blood is returned to the body.:The act of gathering something together.

Concepts.definition: A procedure that collects white blood cells from the peripheral blood while returning the rest to the donor.
The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).
